intro: Panciatica, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. Its blooming period occurs during the summer months, adding vibrant color to gardens and natural habitats.
